snippet: All of the current proposals for dealing with the "fiscal cliff" would fall far short of the $4 trillion over a decade needed to keep the country's debt-to-G.D.P. ratio stable.
abstract: All of the current proposals for dealing with the "fiscal cliff" would fall far short of the $4 trillion over a decade needed to keep the country's debt-to-G.D.P. ratio stable.

headline.main: From All Sides, Fiscal Plans Fall Far Short of What's Needed
